subject: Home & DIY
title: 3D-Printed Furniture Is Coming
description: A micro-lesson that makes 3D-Printed Furniture Is Coming usable.

hook.text: A Dutch company 3D-prints full-size chairs from recycled ocean plastic in under 3 hours. No molds, no waste, no factory.

buildup.text: Large-format 3D printers can now produce furniture using plastics, resins, concrete, and even recycled wood fiber.

discovery.text: Each piece can be unique at no extra cost. Customization that once required hand craftsmanship is now a file change.

twist.text: 3D-printed strength depends on layer bonding. Under stress, furniture can shatter along the lines between layers.

climax.text: As materials improve, local micro-factories could print furniture on demandâ€”no shipping, no inventory, no warehouses.

punchline.text: Download a chair. Print it tonight.

quiz.question: What is the main structural weakness of 3D-printed furniture?
options: It can shatter along layer bonding lines under stress
It dissolves in water over time
It's too heavy for residential use
